Bertemu Mendag AS, Luhut: Jangan Lihat Cina atau Amerika
06 Nov 2019, 10:08 by Eko Wahyudi, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Menteri Koordinator Bidang Kemaritiman Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan menggelar pertemuan dengan Menteri Perdagangan Amerika Serikat, Wilbur Ross di kantor Kemenko Maritim dan Investasi. Pertemuan itu membahas masalah investasi dan perdagangan kedua negara.
Luhut mengatakan, diskusinya dengan Mendag Amerika Serikat telah berjalan baik, dan semua diterima tanpa ada hambatan. "Jadi saya kira sekarang ini harus kita lihat jangan lihat Cina, jangan lihat Amerika, sekarang semua dunia itu sudah mulai terintegrasi," ujar Luhut di kantornya, Rabu 6 November 2019.
Sebelumnya, sempat muncul kekhawatiran bahwa kedekatan hubungan ekonomi Indonesia-Cina akan membuat AS memusuhi Indonesia, mengingat kedua negara dengan ekonomi terbesar itu sedang terlibat perang dagang. Namun ternyata, pemerintah Amerika Serikat tetap menganggap Indonesia sebagai mitra yang sangat penting bagi negaranya kendati pemerintahan Presiden Jokowi cukup mesra dengan Beijing.
“Masih ada banyak peluang dan bisnis bagi pihak swasta di negara seperti Indonesia,” kata Under Secretary for Economic Growth, Energy, and Environment, Departemen Luar Negeri Amerika Serikat, Keith Krach dalam konferensi pers di ajang Indo-Pacific Business Forum (IPBF) di Bangkok, Thailand, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Luhut pun mengklaim bahwa pertemuannya dengan Mendag AS berjalan hangat dan pihak Amerika mengapresiasi keterbukaan pemerintah Indonesia sekarang.
"Tadi pertemuan dengan Wilbur Ross berlangsung sangat baik kita banyak ketawa-ketawa, tapi substansinya juga semua tercover dengan baik. Dia memberikan apresiasi terhadap keterbukaan pemerintah sekarang ini dan begitu cepatnya dalam memberikan respons," kata Luhut.
Pertemuan dengan Wilbur Ross itu juga dihadiri Menteri Energi dan Sumber Daya Mineral (ESDM) Arifin Tasrif dan Wakil Menteri Luar Negeri Mehendra Siregar. Adapun Mendag AS membawa 25 bos perusahaan asal negeri Abang Sam seperti Honeywell, Tesla, Qualcomm, dan Citibank.
Luhut mengatakan, telah mengajak beberapa perusahaan otomotif seperti Tesla, Volks Wagen, Mercedez, dan BMW, serta perusahaan lithium baterai CATL (Contemporary Amperex Technology) untuk ikut invetasi dalam sektor baterai. Karena, larangan ekspor nikel mentah atau ore sudah mulai diberlakukan 1 Januari 2019 sehingga produsen baterai harus membuat pabrik di Indonesia.
"Jadi semua terkoneksi, tadi pagi kita bicara bagaimana produksi Freeport bisa smelting asam sulfatnya bisa digunakan di Morowal. Sehingga (pembuatan) produk turunanya bisa berkembang di Indonesia," kata Luhut.
Luhut mengatakan, pabrik pengolahan nikel di Morowali, Sulawesi Selatan, sudah mulai tampak hasilnya. Kini, Indonesia menjadi salah satu rantai pasokan global produk olahan nikel. "Jadi kita kita harus terbuka dengan foreign direct invesment dan tidak menutup diri," kata dia.

EKO WAHYUDI | FAJAR PEBRIANTO

Meeting with the US Minister of Trade, Luhut: Don't look at China or America
Nov 6, 2019, 10:08 by Eko Wahyudi, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan held a meeting with the United States Minister of Trade, Wilbur Ross at the Office of the Maritime and Investment Coordinating Ministry. The meeting discussed issues of investment and trade between the two countries.
Luhut said, his discussion with the US Minister of Trade had been going well, and all were accepted without obstacles. "So I think we should look now, don't look at China, don't look at America, now all the world has begun to be integrated," Luhut said in his office, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
Previously, there were concerns that the close relations between the Indonesian-Chinese economy would make the US hostile to Indonesia, bearing in mind that the two countries with the largest economy were involved in a trade war. But apparently, the United States government still considers Indonesia as a very important partner for his country even though President Jokowi's government is quite intimate with Beijing.
"There are still many opportunities and businesses for private parties in countries such as Indonesia," said Under Secretary for Economic Growth, Energy, and Environment, US Department of State, Keith Krach during a press conference at the Indo-Pacific Business Forum (IPBF) in Bangkok, Thailand, Monday, November 4 2019.
Luhut also claimed that his meeting with the US Minister of Trade went warm and the Americans appreciated the openness of the current Indonesian government.
"Earlier the meeting with Wilbur Ross went very well. We laughed a lot, but the substance was also well covered. He appreciated the openness of the current government and how quickly it responded," Luhut said.
The meeting with Wilbur Ross was also attended by Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) Arifin Tasrif and Deputy Foreign Minister Mehendra Siregar. The US Trade Minister brought 25 bosses from Abang Sam's domestic companies such as Honeywell, Tesla, Qualcomm, and Citibank.
Luhut said, had invited several automotive companies such as Tesla, Volks Wagen, Mercedez, and BMW, as well as the lithium battery company CATL (Contemporary Amperex Technology) to participate in the battery sector. Because, the ban on the export of raw nickel or ore has been put into effect January 1, 2019 so that battery manufacturers must build factories in Indonesia.
"So everything is connected, this morning we talked about how Freeport's production of smelting sulfuric acid can be used in Morowal. So (the production of) the product can be developed in Indonesia," said Luhut.
Luhut said the nickel processing plant in Morowali, South Sulawesi, had begun to show results. Today, Indonesia is one of the global supply chains for nickel products. "So we we have to open with foreign direct investment and not close ourselves," he said.

EKO WAHYUDI | FAJAR PEBRIANTO
